Crossover that acts as a perturbed mean of two individuals. x_i = p*x1_i + (1-p)*x2_i p - uniform random value over [0,1]. Averaging over line means p is same for every i, averaging over space if different p is chosen for each i. See CrossoverOperator for general description, also see feature request 708774
Compares this GeneticOperator against the specified object. The result is true if and the argument is an instance of this class and is equal wrt the data.

simplesect.para: true: if the objects are the same, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Compares the given object to this one.

parameterdescription.para: the instance against which to compare this instance

simplesect.para: a negative number if this instance is "less than" the given instance, zero if they are equal to each other, and a positive number if this is "greater than" the given instance

parameterdescription.para: crossover rate to use by this crossover operator

memberdef.argsstring: (final RandomGenerator a_generator, final int a_index, final int a_max)
memberdef.name: getLocus

detaileddescription.para: Returns the crossover location for a given index. For each index the crossover locatio is the same, therefor it is cached!

parameterdescription.para: to generate random values the first time
the index of the crossover operation

simplesect.para: crossover location for a given index

detaileddescription.para: The averaging crossover operator randomly selects two Chromosomes from the population and "mates" them by randomly picking a gene and then swapping that gene and all subsequent genes between the two Chromosomes. The two modified Chromosomes are then added to the list of candidate Chromosomes. This operation is performed half as many times as there are Chromosomes in the population. Additionally, the loci of crossing over are cached for each index, i.e., after randomizing the loci for each index once, they don't change again.
If you work with CompositeGene's, this operator expects them to contain genes of the same type (e.g. IntegerGene). If you have mixed types, please provide your own crossover operator.
